It also depends on what assassin, what tank, and how well each of them played. 

For an example {{champion:14}} is fighting {{champion:238}}. 
If Zeds good enough to use his skills to dodge Sions fairly telegraphed abilities, out sustain his mana with his energy, be basically ungankable, and play the map better with roaming (which is kinda what assassins do) then Zed should win just from out performin mg Sion.

>If Zeds good enough to use his skills to dodge Sions fairly telegraphed abilities .... be basically ungankable

Given Zeds early CDs, those two kinda exclude each other.
If you can force Zed to commit his W in order to dodge your stuff, he no longer can be agressive without exposeing himself to ganks, meaning you now have priority and can controll the wave.
Sion is by far the best tank for laneing against anyone, which is why he's still a strong toplaner. His stuff may be telegraphed, but his basevalues are huge, the cds not that great and the waveclear is massive, his mana is not a big issue and befor tear 2 boots, his telegraphed skills still force mobillity tools in order to avoid them.

Sion could probably win that lane with better wave clear.
Also, even if he doesn't land his knock up, being able to shout > Q charge to force Zed to shadow when he doesn't want to is pretty good and keeps Zed's all in potential under control.
Sion might not win an outright fight, but he can control the Zed and not let him do what he wants either until Zed falls off and Sion pops off on farm.

You can just push Zeds shit in. Buy some armour/health first back before Zed hits 6, and then he can’t kill you anymore (until around 3+ items). I don’t see a world in which Zed accomplishes anything vs Sion mid. 

You’ll neutralize him mid lane, undiveable in side lanes, and more impactful in teamfights. It has a lot to do with the fact that Sion is one of the few tanks that’s actually strong right now.

This is a blanket reply to a lot of people.  Tanks should be safe and strong bc they can't carry.  The ultimate reward - carrying, should carry a lot of risk.  Hence, tanks should have less risk, which means good laning.  Strong laning should be a direct counter to about all assassins, as assassins aren't only designed to carry but are also designed to snowball.  Those rewards equate to extreme high levels or risk.  If they do not, assassins override the building blocks of the game and start to erode the meta.  Why play marksmen if assassin carries harder, earlier, and cheaper?  Why play strong split push if an assassin can regularly get strong fast and take that option away?  Why play a mage and wait to get one-shot ulted before an assassin even finishes an item?  Why play a tank if _tanks are risky_ to lane with bc strong assassins?  The last point sums it all up, if tanks are riskier picks than assassins then the game is doing something wrong, whether or not I am a fan of either.
My friend, you won't receive any likes for making great sense because it is against the boards rules and regulations.

Tanks aren’t automatically tanky at the start of the game.

Assassins have strong early game power. Tanks have stronger mid game power, after they’ve gotten their items and before the enemy DPS have their pen items. That means that usually, an assassin is going to beat you in lane early, and if they snowball enough, they’ll beat you into midgame too.
